page.title: 10RECREATION,CHILDREN'S GAMES
page.content: HERE ARE TWO EXAMPLES OF GAMES, CHILDREN PLAY DURING PLAYTIMES AT APPLEDORE SCHOOL {CHOCOLATE}.ONE CHILD IS (IT)AND STANDS WITH HER BACK TO THE OTHER PLAYERS WHO ATTEMPS TO CREEP UP ON HER WITHOUT BEING SEEN WHEN SHE TURNS ROUND.A PLAYER WHO IS SEEN IS OUT,BUT CAN BE TAKEN BACK INTO THE GAME BY THE OTHERS IF NOT SEEN BY (IT)THE FIRST PLAYER TO BE SEEN BY (IT) SAYS CHOCOLATE {BULLDOG.}ONE PLAYER IS IN A CIRCLE. PLAYERS ARE GIVEN A NUMBER.IF (IT) CALLS A NUMBER,HE CHASES THAT PLAYER,WHO SHOUTS BULLDOG IF HE GETS OVER THE BOUNDARY LINE.IF HE IS CAUGHT BEFORE THIS HE JOINS (IT)AND HELPS TO CATCH THE OTHERS.
